name: Butterfly Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just arrived back from 10 days in the Butterfly Beach Hotel, before we went we had taken a close look at the reviews which were on this site and were expecting basic enough but nice and this is what we got but there are a few downsides aswell, firstly the dogs, if your wanting to get up between 6.30 and 7 o clock every morning your fine, if your not your in trouble because they start every morning without fail, secondly some of the staff were not very plesant, John and Jennifer are very good, after that dont expect to be served very quickly, in saying that though the food is very nice, the menus are basic enough alright but very nicely cooked, these would be the 2 main points, security can leave a bit to be desired at times and there would be people in around the hotel at times selling but this didnt happen very often when we were there. The hotel is close to both Oistins and Lawarances Gap which is great for the fish fry in Oistins and there are alot of restaurants and bars in Lawarances Gap. There is also access to 2 lovely beaches from the hotel. All in all we got what we paid for but wouldnt be in a hurry to go back.
reviews.title: Basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first time to Barbados with my partner Tom. The hotel staff were friendly and we had no problems apart from the view out of our window. To be honest the view did not bother me as I kept the curtains closed. The food in the hotel was very good, cooked to a high standard. The hotel is a little out of the way, but again no problem for me. We had two weeks stay in the hotel, we came away with super sun tans, opps my partner is a Dr....
reviews.title: Had a great time at Butterfly Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is to be recommended. The food is good, the staff are helpful (some of the restaurant and bar staff were a bit slow and unhelpful though) and the hotel enjoys a lovely coastal position, with access to two good beaches and a swimming pool.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable; pleasant place to stay for a budget trip to Barbados.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on honeymoon and hoping for a more romantic spot though. The hotel can be quite noisy generally and is under the main flight path to the airport (flights pass over every 20 minutes or so) It was very busy and so difficult to get good shady spots by the pool (more poolside umbrellas definitely needed!) Also the joy of being by the Caribbean is often marred by the premiership football matches blaring out from the big screen at breakfast time!
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One last negative is the fact that there is not a lot to do around the hotel. If you get sick of eating in the hotel, there are very few alternatives within walking distance. However, get one of the crazy taxi buses - a great laugh and only $2 for a trip to the Gap.
reviews.title: Excellent Service + Excellent Value = Fabulous Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: We have stayed @ the Butterfly Beach Hotel several times and absolutely love it.
reviews.title: Excellent! Heaven on Earth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff, location, rooms and facilities are superb.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Butterfly Beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Barbados. Returning December 2011 for our wedding.
reviews.title: paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend took me to Barbados for my 28th birthday and we could not of stayed at a better place. The staff was very friendly and genuine. The hotel was clean and right on the best, close to Oistins where you must go for the fish fry!
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is small in front of the hotel which is perfect because you can have your privacy. Free shuttle into Bridgetown everyday and the lady at the travel desk will cater any tour to your liking.
reviews.title: Good choice at the South Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Me and my friend have just come back from a 12 night stay at Butterfly Beach. This was our second visit to Barbados - our first holiday was staying at a luxurious hotel up the coast - which was lovely but very expensive. We decided to go back to Barbados on a budget and can honestly say that for a third of the price, Butterfly Beach was on par with the first hotel we stayed in.
reviews.title: Brilliant Location, Brilliant Staff & Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel rooms are kept clean to a very high standard the rooms come with all the standard amenities, kettle, pots and pans, hob (no oven) glasses plates and cooking utensils. We had a twin room which came with two single beds - they are larger than an english single bed though so its not a problem.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar staff are great and treat all guests really well, John and Yvette in particular. The food in the restaurant is tasty but there are loads of restuarants around so you should go and try some proper Bajan Food. Oistins on a Friday is a must, a chance to see the locals enjoying themselves. The hotel is very safe and security are always around watching over everyone.
reviews.title: If you are intent on going to Barbados, stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The beach is small but serves its purpose and never really gets busy which is great. The pool is also fine - we never actually went in it as we were in the sea all the time. The sea wasnt calm but i find it boring if it is there are little waves but it is not dangerous or not pleasant to swim in. You can hire boogie boards, snorkels flippers etc from the hotel shop for cheap as well.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean and convenient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did read before we went to the hotel about dogs barking and the busy road. Our hotel was near the road and can honestly say it was not a big problem we heard the Z buses annoying horns a few mornings but that is all part of Barbados - dogs we heard twice and that was in the day, so again nothing to be put off by.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean, great view, nice people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all can I just say that some people who have written bad things about this hotel must be expecting 5 star treatment so can I suggest in future they try paying for it! This is a nice hotel for the money but it is a low cost hotel. The rooms are large and there is air conditioning and a fan so very cool. The rooms were kept very clean and floors etc were washed every day. The staff were all lovely and you could have a laugh and a conversation with them all and the security was adequate also. The Reef Grill has some lovely food and is very inexpensive compared to the rest of the island and Oistins is only 10 minutes walk and not to be missed. Our room overlooked the hot tubs and had a sea view and it was lovely to wake up and see the clear blue sea every morning. We hired a car for a few days and toured the island and saw some lovely places. There are not many places to eat nearby so if you don't eat at the hotel you will have to go into the Gap. Don't be put off by negative people this is a lovely hotel with lovely staff and if you do visit please ask Karen in the Reef Grill to tell you about the famous Barbados Albatross!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, lovely staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was booked for us as part of a 3 island tour of the Caribbean so I didn't check the reviews in advance. If I had, I would not have recognised the reality from the reviews. It was pretty poor. We saw no signs of the advertised 'recent renovation'. Our initial reception was appalling - our room was not ready, the receptionist was rude to the extent that I was ready to come home. Our room was large but the cleaning was questionable - the skirtings had not seen a cloth in weeks. Room service appeared to consist of making the bed and straightening the towels. Our bed sheets were not changed during our 7 day stay (a hole in the bottom sheet confirmed this). The restaurant was over-priced and poor quality, and the staff (apart from John) were surly and unfriendly. The pool area had clearly seen better days, with old paint and furniture that was very dirty. We finally decided to use the hotel as a base, only eating the non-cooked element of the breakfast, hiring a car and seeing the island, (with thanks to Deborah on the tour desk) - and found the hotel was not representative of Barbados. Our advice would be to stay elsewhere when visiting this beautiful place!
reviews.title: Did I stay at the same hotel as the other reviewers?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved it, bright airy clean rooms. Lovely pool area and close to the beach. Fantastic views. What made this hotel great is its friendly staff. Food was excellent and great value. We dined in hotel most nights. It;s a bit far from other towns but Z buses go everywhere for 2 BB dollers so that solves that problem. Activities were a bit expensive but if you just want to rexax by the pool or beach then this is the place for you. Plenty of security staff about so you feel safe. I would heartily recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great friendly hotel, great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in upgraded Ocean View Superior room, definitely worth the extra money for the beautiful views of the sea & surrounding headland. Disappointed that most of the two beaches have been washed away since our last visit to the area in 2009, but the hotel has some lovely decked areas around the pool, jacuzzis & right next to the sea. Make sure you have plenty of very high factor sun screen (50+) as there is no shade on the beach and you don't realise how vicious the sun is with the constant breeze.
reviews.title: Good value for money, nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel staff are friendly & pleasant if you are pleaseant with them (except the bar/restaurant staff who thought it was a real chore to serve you).
reviews.title: great location - no frills

description: We are located on the South Coast of Barbados in an ocean front setting with access to two white-sand beaches, and a friendly and relaxed atmosphere. Refurbished in June 2009, we are an excellent hotel for those looking for a self-catering but full-service property near to all the amenities the island has to offer...
